verses.text: The burden against Nineveh.
parts: The burden against Nineveh.

verses.text: God is jealous, and the Lord is an avenger; the Lord is avenging with fury; the Lord takes vengeance on His adversaries and drives out His enemies.
parts: God is jealous, and the Lord is an avenger; the Lord is avenging with fury; the Lord takes vengeance on His adversaries and drives out His enemies.

verses.text: The Lord is patient and His power is great, but the Lord will not acquit the guilty.
parts: The Lord is patient and His power is great, but the Lord will not acquit the guilty.

verses.text: He threatens the sea and makes it dry, and he dries up all the rivers.
parts: He threatens the sea and makes it dry, and he dries up all the rivers.

verses.text: By Him the mountains are shaken and the hills quake, and the earth heaves at His presence—the whole earth and all who dwell in it.
parts: By Him the mountains are shaken and the hills quake, and the earth heaves at His presence—the whole earth and all who dwell in it.

verses.text: Who can stand before His wrath?
parts: Who can stand before His wrath?

verses.text: The Lord is merciful to those who wait on Him in the day of affliction, and He knows those who reverence Him.
parts: The Lord is merciful to those who wait on Him in the day of affliction, and He knows those who reverence Him.

verses.text: For with an overwhelming flood He shall make an end to those rising up, and darkness will pursue His enemies.
parts: For with an overwhelming flood He shall make an end to those rising up, and darkness will pursue His enemies.

verses.text: What do you plot against the Lord?
parts: What do you plot against the Lord?

verses.text: for the enemy shall be laid bare even to the foundations, and consumed as twisted yew, even as fully dried stubble.
parts: for the enemy shall be laid bare even to the foundations, and consumed as twisted yew, even as fully dried stubble.

verses.text: From out of you shall come forth a plot against the Lord, counseling things hostile to Him.
parts: From out of you shall come forth a plot against the Lord, counseling things hostile to Him.

verses.text: Thus says the Lord who rules over many waters: “In the same manner you will be torn apart, and the report of you will no longer be heard.
parts: Thus says the Lord who rules over many waters: “In the same manner you will be torn apart, and the report of you will no longer be heard.

verses.text: And now I will break his rod from off you, and I will break your bonds.”
parts: And now I will break his rod from off you, and I will break your bonds.”

verses.text: The Lord shall Himself give a command concerning you: “Your name shall be perpetuated no longer.
parts: The Lord shall Himself give a command concerning you: “Your name shall be perpetuated no longer.

verses.text: Behold, on the mountains the feet of him that brings good tidings and proclaims peace.
parts: Behold, on the mountains the feet of him that brings good tidings and proclaims peace.

verses.text: The one being delivered from affliction has come up breathing in your presence.
parts: The one being delivered from affliction has come up breathing in your presence.

verses.text: For the Lord has turned away the pride of Jacob, just as He did the pride of Israel, for the shakers have shaken them off and completely destroyed their branches.
parts: For the Lord has turned away the pride of Jacob, just as He did the pride of Israel, for the shakers have shaken them off and completely destroyed their branches.

verses.text: The weapons of their power from men—mocking mighty men with fire, the reins of their chariots in the day of their readiness, and their horsemen—shall be thrown into a state of confusion
parts: The weapons of their power from men—mocking mighty men with fire, the reins of their chariots in the day of their readiness, and their horsemen—shall be thrown into a state of confusion

verses.text: in the streets, and the chariots shall clash and become entangled with one another in the broad roads.
parts: in the streets, and the chariots shall clash and become entangled with one another in the broad roads.

verses.text: And their great men will be remembered, and they will flee by day.
parts: And their great men will be remembered, and they will flee by day.

verses.text: The gates of the rivers have been opened, and the palaces have fallen into ruin, and the foundation has been exposed.
parts: The gates of the rivers have been opened, and the palaces have fallen into ruin, and the foundation has been exposed.

parts: and the foundation has been exposed.

verses.text: And as for Nineveh, her waters are as a pool of water, and fleeing away, they did not stand; there was no one paying attention.
parts: And as for Nineveh, her waters are as a pool of water, and fleeing away, they did not stand; there was no one paying attention.

verses.text: They were plundering the silver, they were plundering the gold—and there was no end of her treasures; they have been weighed down by all her precious things.
parts: They were plundering the silver, they were plundering the gold—and there was no end of her treasures; they have been weighed down by all her precious things.

verses.text: There is thrusting, shaking, and tumult, and breaking of hearts and weakening of knees, agony in every loin, and the face of each one appearing as the blackening of a pot.
parts: There is thrusting, shaking, and tumult, and breaking of hearts and weakening of knees, agony in every loin, and the face of each one appearing as the blackening of a pot.

verses.text: Where is the dwelling place of the lions and the feeding place for her cubs?
parts: Where is the dwelling place of the lions and the feeding place for her cubs?

verses.text: The lion carried off sufficient prey for his cubs, and he strangled prey for his lions and filled his lair with prey, even his dwelling-place of plunder.
parts: The lion carried off sufficient prey for his cubs, and he strangled prey for his lions and filled his lair with prey, even his dwelling-place of plunder.

parts: “Behold, I am against you,” says the Lord Almighty; “I shall burn up your multitude in smoke, and the sword will devour your lions.

verses.text: O city of blood, totally false and full of unrighteousness: the prey will not be touched.
parts: O city of blood, totally false and full of unrighteousness: the prey will not be touched.

verses.text: The cracking of whips and the sound of rumbling wheels, the galloping horses and bounding chariots,
parts: The cracking of whips and the sound of rumbling wheels, the galloping horses and bounding chariots,

verses.text: cavalrymen in full charge with the glistening of swords and the glittering of weapons, a multitude of wounded and of heavy falling; and there was no end to her nations, but they will be weak in their bodies
parts: cavalrymen in full charge with the glistening of swords and the glittering of weapons, a multitude of wounded and of heavy falling; and there was no end to her nations, but they will be weak in their bodies

verses.text: because of the abundance of sexual immorality.
parts: because of the abundance of sexual immorality.

parts: “Behold, I am against you,” says the Lord God Almighty.

verses.text: I shall cast abominable filth upon you according to your uncleanness, and I shall cause you to be a public example.
parts: I shall cast abominable filth upon you according to your uncleanness, and I shall cause you to be a public example.

verses.text: And it will be that all who see you will turn away from you and say, ‘Wretched Nineveh, who shall lament her?
parts: And it will be that all who see you will turn away from you and say, ‘Wretched Nineveh, who shall lament her?

verses.text: Prepare yourself a portion, tune the string of the lyre, and prepare a portion for Amon, the one dwelling by the rivers with the river round about her, whose dominion is the sea and the water her walls.
parts: Prepare yourself a portion, tune the string of the lyre, and prepare a portion for Amon, the one dwelling by the rivers with the river round about her, whose dominion is the sea and the water her walls.

verses.text: Ethiopia is her strength, and Egypt as well, and there is no limit to her flight, and the Libyans became her helper.
parts: Ethiopia is her strength, and Egypt as well, and there is no limit to her flight, and the Libyans became her helper.

verses.text: And she will go into captivity as a prisoner, and they will dash her infants to the ground at the heads of all the streets; they will cast lots over all her splendid things, and all her nobles will be bound in chains.
parts: And she will go into captivity as a prisoner, and they will dash her infants to the ground at the heads of all the streets; they will cast lots over all her splendid things, and all her nobles will be bound in chains.

verses.text: And you will become drunk and be disregarded.
parts: And you will become drunk and be disregarded.

verses.text: All your strongholds are as fig trees having a watchman: if shaken, they will fall into the mouth of the eater!
parts: All your strongholds are as fig trees having a watchman: if shaken, they will fall into the mouth of the eater!

verses.text: Behold, your people are as women among you.
parts: Behold, your people are as women among you.

parts: Draw water for the siege and fortify your strongholds.

parts: There the fire will devour you, and the sword will utterly destroy you.

parts: You have multiplied your commerce beyond the stars of heaven; the locust has attacked and flown away.

parts: As a grasshopper, your crowd of half-breeds has suddenly left, as a locust perched on a hedge on a frosty morning; the sun rises and it flies away.

verses.text: Your shepherds slumber; the king of Assyria put your nobles to rest; your people departed to the mountains, and there was no one expecting them.
parts: Your shepherds slumber; the king of Assyria put your nobles to rest; your people departed to the mountains, and there was no one expecting them.

verses.text: There is no healing your destruction.
parts: There is no healing your destruction.

author: The prophet Nahum (commemorated December 1). His name means “consolation.” He was from the tribe of Simeon and a contemporary of the prophets Zephaniah, Jeremiah, and Habakkuk.
date: Between 663 BC (the fall of Thebes) and 612 BC (the fall of Nineveh)
theme: God's judgment and the destruction of Nineveh (capital of the Assyrian Empire) for its idolatry, oppression, cruelty, and wickedness. Justice will prevail. God is the Lord of history and of all nations, and their destinies are in His hands. Christ is revealed as the One who brings good tidings and proclaims peace (1:15).
